channel.title: Please help me, giving owner to person who helps
channel.description: i have been working on my rsps for a very long time now, it is pi based and i now want to put it online, i have portforwarded correctly dur to me checking it on the portchecker tool but when i put in my no-ip adress, corruptxv2.no-ip.biz it will either say error connecting to server or it will say no response form login server please try another world it is not my computer speed as i have 4gb of ram and a 350gb harddrive if you can help me my server will be 24/7 and i will jump you straight into the owner spot x!

item.title: Please help me, giving owner to person who helps
item.dc:creator: @go_armand go armand
item.description:
@go_armand wrote:

sometimes the moparscape client doesnt let you log in to PI servers. for some reason idk.
so its best if your mate tries with the client you provide.

search for ‘client’ in the client folder.
once that’s open. click on the last line of code.
ctrl F —> then click ‘search upwards’ -----> search “server”

find the line, server = “”
put your server ip inside these “” make sure its changed to your ip and there are no errors in spelling.

save this. complie the client files.
restart your source.
try login again…

if this doesnt work -
make sure ip DUC is running. go to
http://canyouseeme.org/
and enter your port, 43594.
make sure the website says it can see it.

BTW just an after thought…
are you sure your source is running ahhahahaa

Read full topic
item.source: Please help me, giving owner to person who helps

item.title: Please help me, giving owner to person who helps
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

It will always be faster to connect through a computer loop than an ip. Unless you are on a vps, hen you must connect to the vps ip with your own computer of course. Also if you say you have done everything correctly, then there would be no problem right? So double check the steps you took, make sure you did everyhing correctly, didn’t miss a step, etc. Good luck

Read full topic
item.source: Please help me, giving owner to person who helps

item.title: Please help me, giving owner to person who helps
item.dc:creator: @gergy008 gergy008
item.description:
@gergy008 wrote:

Elementalz-X:

You Have to login from 127.0.0.1 Hope I helped

Not necessarily, this will guarantee a connection for the owner but no-one else can join. I connect to my server the same way as everyone else.

item.title: Please help me, giving owner to person who helps
item.dc:creator: @l0lc0pt3r l0lc0pt3r
item.description:
@l0lc0pt3r wrote:

have you been able to get onto your server from this ip before? if you have then it could be that no-ip is trying to delete your ip for inactivity on the actual site, if not then your probably not portforwarded correctly.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help me, giving owner to person who helps

item.title: Please help me, giving owner to person who helps
item.dc:creator: @gergy008 gergy008
item.description:
@gergy008 wrote:

What about windows firewall, Did you allow the port?

Also, To make sure you did the port forward correctly press the windows key + R, type ‘cmd’, hit enter and type ‘ipconfig’. Find ipv4 in there somewhere and make sure that that is the ip you are port forwarding to.

If all else fails I can try to help over teamviewer, I will be performing these steps also.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help me, giving owner to person who helps
